questions.question: A project that satisfy time and cost objectives but fails to create value:
options: Project management success, but project failure
Failure in terms of both project management and project
questions.explanation: As project management success is about the project’s ability to satisfy the contextual and project constraints it will be considered a success if the time and cost objectives are withheld. Project success is about the project’s ability to create value and thereby it would be considered a failure if this was not achieved.

questions.question: A project that creates value to the client but fails to deliver on time or according to budget is a:
questions.explanation: This is a project success as it has created value, however a project management failure because the project did not stay within the constraints of the project.

questions.question: “Our goal is to deliver the project on time” is a:
questions.explanation: It is a success criterion as it describes the desired outcome of the project.

questions.question: “Our goal is to deliver the project with zero accidents” is a:
questions.explanation: It is a success criterion as it describes the desired outcome of the project.

questions.question: “Empowering project team members” could be described as:
questions.explanation: It is a success factor as it describes how the individuals in the project organization should act in order to achieve success.

questions.question: “We shall adhere to our commitments” is a:
questions.explanation: It is a success factor as it describes how the individuals in the project organization should act in order to achieve success.

questions.question: Achieving project management success is a prerequisite for achieving project success.
questions.explanation: Project management success is about the project’s ability to satisfy the contextual and project constraints, while project success is about the project’s ability to create value. As it is possible to satisfy one or the other this is false.

questions.question: Project management failure lead to project failure.
questions.explanation: Project management success is about the project’s ability to satisfy the contextual and project constraints, while project success is about the project’s ability to create value. As it is possible to satisfy one or the other this is false.

questions.question: The definition of success in project has changed from:
options: Being limited to the project life cycle to the entire life cycle of the product or service
Entailing the entire product life cycle to being limited to the project life cycle
Being limited to the project life cycle to entailing several projects completed by the same project organization
questions.explanation: There exist several models that describe and classify the success factors of the project several years after completion and from the views of various stakeholders.

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the four types of success according to Shenhar:
options: Business success for the parent organization
questions.explanation: See p. 55.

questions.question: The subjective approach of defining success criteria  assume that estimated time and cost of the project can be predicted in the beginning.
questions.explanation: This is an assumption of the objective approach.

questions.question: The objective approach of defining success criteria  assume that all stakeholders will have the perception of the project
questions.explanation: This assumption is true, and is the main difference between the objective and the subjective approach. More information can be found at p. 54 in Road to Success.

questions.question: The first researcher to propose the distinction between project management success and project success was:
questions.explanation: More information can be found at p. 55 in Road to Success.

questions.question: Wilson and Howcroft are important in project management literature as they:
options: Illustrated that the subjective evaluation of whether a project was a success or not is merely a way of legitimize the events of the project
Linked project management success to process success and established several guidelines for businesses to achieve these
questions.explanation: More information can be found at p. 55-58 in Road to Success. Cooke-Davis developed the model describing the success factor categories.

questions.question: Project success is about:
options: how certain stakeholders perceive project implementation phase.
the ability of the project to create value
satisfying various project and contextual constraints

questions.question: Process success is about:
options: how certain stakeholders perceive project implementation phase.
the ability of the project to create value.
satisfying various project and contextual constraints.

questions.question: Project management success is about:
options: how certain stakeholders perceive project implementation phase.
the ability of the project to create value
satisfying various project and contextual constraints

questions.question: A success factor is:
options: Measurable indicators used to assess project outcome
Ground rules we collect after completing the project
Activities that should be followed during project planning and execution

questions.question: Success criterion is:
options: Measurable indicators used to assess project outcome
Ground rules we collect after completing the project
Activities that should be followed during project planning and execution

questions.question: Identifying success factors upfront in projects ensures project success.
questions.explanation: Project success is about the project’s ability to create value. Although it might be wise to identify the success factors, it is not given that this will lead to project success

questions.question: Which statement is true regarding structural success factors:
options: Generalizable and correlated with project characteristics
Generalizable and independent of project characteristics
questions.explanation: A structural success factor describes what the people within the project organization and its stakeholders can do in order to achieve success. It may be linked with certain project characteristics, and thus, they are generalizable.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a structural success factor:
questions.explanation: Trust is a cultural factor, also known as a soft factor.

questions.question: Which statement is true regarding cultural success factors:
options: Generalizable and correlated with project characteristics
Generalizable and independent of project characteristics
questions.explanation: Cultural success factors describe elements regarding the culture within the organization and with its stakeholders that should be in place in order to achieve success. They are generalizable across project characteristics. There is no ideal culture in the existence of a certain project characteristic.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a cultural success factor:
questions.explanation: Adequate information flow to stakeholders is a structural success factor that is important if the project has a high level of complexity.

questions.question: End-user/stakeholders’ involvement is a critical success factor in a project that:
options: Has high level of intended transformation
questions.explanation: To achieve the intended transformation the involvement of stakeholders is a critical success factor as it is important to create a willingness and desire for change among the stakeholders for the transformation to set foot.

questions.question: Cultural factors must be complied with in order to be able to:
options: To create positive and good working environment
questions.explanation: Cultural factors describes elements regarding the culture within the organization and with its stakeholders that should be in place in order to achieve success. Hence certain cultural factors will have a great impact on the working environment.

questions.question: Project management failure lead to project failure.
questions.explanation: Project management success is about the project’s ability to satisfy the contextual and project constraints, while project success is about the project’s ability to create value. As it is possible to satisfy one or the other this is false.

questions.question: “Common understanding of the importance of the project to the entire organization” is a critical success factor when there is a high level of/many:
questions.explanation: When the project has a great impact on business it is important to create ownership and dedication to the objectives of the project. This is usually accomplished by creating a common understanding for the importance of the project.

questions.question: Having clear roles and responsibilities” is a critical success factor when there is a high level of/many:
questions.explanation: Clear roles and responsibilities are important if there is a high level of organizational complexity as these projects often run parallelly with other tasks. In this case it is important to ensure that the individuals know what they need to ensure progress in the project.

questions.question: “Project leader authority” is a critical success factor when there is a high level of/many:
questions.explanation: This success factor is critical to ensure progress in the project.

questions.question: “Routines for deviation” is a critical success factor when there is a high level of/many:
questions.explanation: Routines for deviation is important to ensure efficient handling of problems and/or deviation, as this will reduce the risk of extra costs, lower quality and time overruns.

questions.question: “Project manager has adequate business insights” is a critical success factor when there is a high level of/many:
questions.explanation: In order to convince stakeholders that the transformation is in their best interests, it is important that the project manager understands the needs and impact of various stakeholders and include them when necessary.

questions.question: “Experienced project manager and project group” is a critical success factor when there is a high level of/many:
questions.explanation: When there is a high level of uncertainty it is easier to handle deviation and elements of uncertainty when the project organization holds the “right” expertise.

questions.question: According to Gutierrez and Hussein, normative conformity may lead to:
questions.explanation: Normative conformity is a change in behavior or belief as a result one’s desire to fulfill others’ expectations and gain acceptance. Often individuals fear expressing their opinions and ideas, hence losing valuable insight and creativity.

questions.question: Project success factors can be defined as:
options: Measurable indicators used to assess project outcome
Ground rules we collect after completing the project
Measurable indicators used to assess project output
Ground rules that will govern the project

questions.question: “Demands that describe how the requirements should be implemented, outlining the solution” is a/are
A project is organizational complex when:
options: It requires contribution from multiple organizational units
The problem has many constraints complicating the project
There is a high level of uncertainty

questions.question: Loyalty and affiliation towards an organization that one is working with is:
The extent to which one party is willing to depend on somebody, or something, in a given situation with a feeling of relative security is:
Normative conformity is:
options: a cognitive bias that causes us to attribute too much weight to past events and translate them into future expectations
a change in behavior or belief as a result one’s desire to fulfill others’ expectations and gain acceptance

questions.question: The focusing effect is:
options: a behavioral bias that occurs when human decision-making process attempt to satisfice
a cognitive bias that causes us to attribute too much weight to past events and translate them into future expectations.

questions.question: Bounded rationality is:
options: a behavioral bias that occurs when human decision-making process attempt to satisfice
a cognitive bias that causes us to attribute too much weight to past events and translate them into future expectations.

questions.explanation: Project success is about the project’s ability to create value. Although it might be wise to identify the success factors, it is not given that this will lead to project success

Measurable indicators used to assess project output
